item.title: Prescription drugs are the 3rd cause of all US deaths, 4th cause of deaths in hospital
item.description:
Prescription Drugs Are the Leading Cause of Death

Brownstone

  • “37,309 drug deaths were reported to the FDA in 2006 and
    123,927 ten years later, which is 3.3 times as many”

  • “Depression drugs kill many people, mainly among the elderly, because they can cause orthostatic hypotension, sedation, confusion, and dizziness. The drugs double the risk of falls and hip fractures in a dose-dependent manner,8,9 and within one year after a hip fracture, about one-fifth of the patients will have died. As elderly people often fall anyway, it is not possible to know if such deaths are drug deaths.”

item.title: Early-Onset diseases and Vitamin D - several studies
item.description:
Candidate causes include:
Low vitamin D (which can be fought by Vitamin D)
((Microplastics causing problems in most life forms (Vitamin D might help)- many studies Microplastics))
((Ultra-processed foods associated with worse health and lower Vitamin D - many studies Ultra-processed foods))
((Air Pollution reduces Vitamin D production - many studies Air pollution))
((DDT and other pesticides decrease vitamin D Pesticides))
      • 40,700 studies had EARLY-ONSET in their title as of April 2024

40,700 studies had EARLY-ONSET in their title as of April 2024

Google Scholar

item.title: US IRS now favors drugs over wellness
item.description:
• IRS Cracks Down on Deductions for Healthy Food, Exercise as Childhood Chronic Disease Epidemic Explodes

IRS Cracks Down on Deductions for Healthy Food, Exercise as Childhood Chronic Disease Epidemic Explodes

ChildrenHealthDefense

Includes a link to the 40 minute podcast

  • “March 6 IRS “reminder” warning that people who use health savings accounts (HSAs) and flexible spending accounts (FSAs) will no longer be able to deduct “nutrition, wellness and general health” expenses — even if a doctor provides a note recommending them — unless they are “related to a targeted diagnosis-specific activity or treatment.””

item.title: Ultra-processed foods associated with worse health and lower Vitamin D - many studies
item.description:

What health problems are associated with Ultraprocessed foods - Asked Perplexity AI Aug 2024

Based on the search results, there is strong evidence that high consumption of ultra-processed foods is associated with numerous adverse health outcomes:
